user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8 is: A function parameter should not be modified.
Note that the object referred to by a pointer parameter may be modified, but the pointer itself shall not be modified.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of UtAssertEx:
```c
bool UtAssertEx(bool Expression, UtAssert_CaseType_t CaseType, const char *File, uint32 Line, const char *MessageFormat,
                ...)
{
    va_list va;
    char    FinalMessage[256];
    uint32  TestSegmentCount;
    uint32  TotalTestCases;

    UT_BSP_Lock();

    ++UT_SegmentCounters.TotalTestCases;

    if (Expression)
    {
        CaseType = UTASSERT_CASETYPE_PASS;
    }

    if ((uint32)CaseType < UTASSERT_CASETYPE_MAX)
    {
        ++UT_SegmentCounters.CaseCount[(uint32)CaseType];
    }

    TestSegmentCount = 1 + UT_TotalCounters.TestSegmentCount;
    TotalTestCases   = UT_SegmentCounters.TotalTestCases;

    UT_BSP_Unlock();

    va_start(va, MessageFormat);
    vsnprintf(FinalMessage, sizeof(FinalMessage), MessageFormat, va);
    va_end(va);

    UtAssert_DoReport(File, Line, TestSegmentCount, TotalTestCases, CaseType, CurrentSegment, FinalMessage);

    return Expression;
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: Only the assignment to the parameter 'CaseType' modifies a function parameter and therefore needs investigation under MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8. Other code fragments do not modify parameters: - ++UT_SegmentCounters.TotalTestCases and ++UT_SegmentCounters.CaseCount[...] modify global objects, not function parameters. - TestSegmentCount and TotalTestCases are local variables assigned from globals; these assignments do not change any parameter. - va_start(va, MessageFormat), vsnprintf(..., MessageFormat, va), and va_end(va) use the variadic parameter but do not modify the MessageFormat parameter itself. - FinalMessage is a local buffer written by vsnprintf, not a parameter. - Passing File, Line, CaseType, etc. to UtAssert_DoReport transmits values but does not modify the original parameters in this function. - Casting (uint32)CaseType and using it as an index does not modify the parameter. Therefore no other fragments violate the rule.
